intro: Galium elatum var. dumetorum, commonly known as silverweed, is a low-growing perennial herb native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It features prostrate or ascending stems that are often covered in dense, silvery-white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and usually have a slightly hairy surface. Galium elatum var. dumetorum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks.
